meanings.definition: Cause slight but persistent annoyance, discomfort, or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The loose thread on my shirt would niggle me all day.
meanings.sent2: It can niggle at you when you forget something important.
meanings.sent3: The noisy clock seemed to niggle the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The unanswered question continued to niggle at the back of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet would niggle at his sanity like a persistent drumbeat.

meanings.definition: A slight feeling of annoyance or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The constant background noise was a niggle during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Her headache was just a small niggle compared to her stomach ache.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pebble in his shoe became a playful little niggle.
meanings.sent4: The old injury was a niggle that reminded him of his past adventures.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag in his shirt was a constant niggle against his skin.
